description.plain:
Diamante Anthony Blackmon, professionally known as Gordo (and previously as Carnage), is a record producer and DJ from Walkersville, Maryland.

In 2021, Carnage debuted “GORDO,” his new stage name and persona dedicated to crafting dance and house music. In his 2022 interview with TMZ, Carnage explained that his transition was due to burnout from traveling and having done multiple records with hip-hop’s biggest stars.

body.plain:
Diamante Anthony Blackmon, professionally known as Gordo (and previously as Carnage), is a record producer and DJ from Walkersville, Maryland.

In 2021, Carnage debuted “GORDO,” his new stage name and persona dedicated to crafting dance and house music. In his 2022 interview with TMZ, Carnage explained that his transition was due to burnout from traveling and having done multiple records with hip-hop’s biggest stars.

songs.full_title: Mase in '97 by Gordo (Ft. Lil Yachty)
songs.title: Mase in ’97

description.plain: In 1997 Mase dropped Harlem World, which has been certified quadruple platinum. However this track is not reminiscent of old school hip-hop. Rather, it features Lil Yachty spitting the fastest bars we’ve heard from him yet. The song dropped on July 1, 2016—the same day as Yachty’s XXL Freshman Freestyle.

songs.artist_names: Gordo (Ft. A$AP Ferg, Lil Uzi Vert & Rich The Kid)
songs.full_title: WDYW by Gordo (Ft. A$AP Ferg, Lil Uzi Vert & Rich The Kid)
songs.title: WDYW
songs.title_with_featured: WDYW (Ft. A$AP Ferg, Lil Uzi Vert & Rich The Kid)

description.plain:
This was one of the tracks available during the months in advance of Papi Gordo, the compilation by DJ Carnage. This track features rappers A$AP Ferg, Lil Uzi Vert & Rich The Kid.

Everyone in this line-up has their own relationship to trap music. Even though Uzi’s from North Philly, his earliest influences hail from Atlanta’s rap scene. New York’s A$AP Ferg is a self-proclaimed “Trap Lord”—not so much for his sound, but for his hustling tendencies. And Rich the Kid, up last on this track, was raised in Atlanta’s trap music scene, alongside Migos.

It’s DJ Carnage who brought this crew together. Carnage got his start making EDM track out of trap songs and declared his sub-genre of music “festival trap,” though he eschewed the title “trap music producer” in 2013.

Charlie Heat, who signed to G.O.O.D. music in 2014, co-produced this track with Carnage. He hails from New Jersey and has previously worked with A$AP Ferg and Uzi. It was his production on Uzi’s first mixtape specifically, that impressed Kanye and got him signed.

songs.embed_content: Read “WDYW” by Gordo on Genius

songs.title: Bricks

description.plain:
DJ Carnage calls on Migos for his latest single, “Bricks.” The song’s topic is one that the young Atlanta group rap about often, as they bring their crazy energy to the new record. The up-tempo production from DJ Carnage goes along perfectly with the Migos flow on the song. This one might be in rotation for the rest of the summer.

Carnage described the track as “real trap music… Not all of that wanna be rap/trap shit..”

songs.embed_content: Read “Bricks” by Gordo on Genius
